comments.content:
Why not the others?
A. Configure access control lists:
While ACLs are important for network security, they are not directly related to setting up web authentication via a captive portal.

B. Pair Cisco MSE to Cisco Prime Infrastructure:
This step is more about network management and monitoring, not specifically about configuring authentication for the captive portal.

C. Configure the client for authentication:
The client (user device) does not need special configuration for web-based authentication via a captive portal. The redirection and authentication process is handled by the network infrastructure.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D. Configure Cisco MSE to allow mobile authentication:
Since the engineer is using a Facebook page for authentication via a captive portal, the Cisco Mobility Services Engine (MSE) must be configured to allow mobile authentication. This ensures that users can authenticate using their Facebook credentials.

E. Configure WLAN for authentication:
The Wireless LAN (WLAN) must be configured to support the authentication method (e.g., web authentication via the captive portal). This ensures that users connecting to the Wi-Fi are redirected to the Facebook login page for authentication.

Selected Answer: AE
spoto answer AE

Selected Answer: AE
Yes, see the link from Billy2G
C must be wrong, admin cannot configure clients on public wifi.

choices.B: Pair Cisco MSE to Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
choices.D: Configure Cisco MSE to allow mobile authentication.

questions.question_text: An engineer is setting up web authentication for the public Wi-Fi. The installation will take place in a retail store. The existing Facebook page to log in to the captive portal must be used. The engineer already paired the Cisco MSE to the Facebook page. Which two actions complete the configuration? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Enable Office Extend AP on the Flex Profile.
choices.A: Enable Local Switching under the WLAN.
choices.B: Configure Remote LAN under the Remote LAN.
choices.C: Create a Flex Group and add the AR
choices.E: Configure NAT on the physical interface.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
To provide a secure wireless network from a Cisco Catalyst 9800 Series Wireless Controller to a Cisco AP for remote users, while supporting a locally-installed IP phone, the following actions are required:

A. Enable Local Switching under the WLAN:

Local Switching allows traffic to be forwarded locally at the AP instead of tunneling all traffic back to the Wireless Controller. This is necessary for the locally-installed IP phone to function properly, as it requires local network access.

D. Enable Office Extend AP on the Flex Profile:

Office Extend AP (OEAP) is a feature that allows remote APs to securely connect to the corporate network over the Internet. Enabling this feature on the Flex Profile ensures that the remote AP can establish a secure connection to the Wireless Controller and provide the corporate WLAN to remote users.

Selected Answer: BD
Spoto answer BD

Selected Answer: BD
Agree with GoldLeader

Selected Answer: BD
I think answer should be B. not A. to support the IP phone needing to use an additional Ethernet port on the AP.

questions.question_text: A customer must provide a secure wireless network from a Cisco Catalyst 9800 Series Wireless Controller to a Cisco AP to remote users. The corporate WLAN must be provided over the Internet to specific locations and support a locally-installed IP phone. Which two actions accomplish this configuration? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Map the pools to the SSIDs.
choices.C: Enable all radios on the APs.
choices.D: Add the users in Cisco ISE.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Enable all radios on the APs: If the SSIDs are not visible, it is likely that the radios (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) on the access points (APs) are not enabled. Enabling the radios ensures that the APs broadcast the SSIDs, making them visible to wireless clients.

Why not the other options?
A. Map the pools to the SSIDs: This is related to IP address allocation but does not affect the visibility of SSIDs.

B. Configure RADIUS for the SSIDs: RADIUS configuration is for authentication and is not required for SSID visibility.

D. Add the users in Cisco ISE: Adding users in Cisco ISE is for authentication and access control but does not impact SSID visibility.

Thus, the correct action is to enable all radios on the APs to ensure the SSIDs are broadcast and visible on the respective floors.

questions.question_text: A network engineer performed a new deployment of Cisco DNA Center. The engineer discovered and provisioned all APs and converted them to fabric. The SSIDs were created, and the APs were allocated to the respective floors, but the SSIDs are not being seen on the floors. What must be configured to establish this connectivity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Security index results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure

Explanation:
Security index results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure: Cisco Prime Infrastructure provides a Security Index that evaluates the security posture of the wireless network. It identifies vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and compliance issues, making it the best source for identifying security weaknesses.

Why not the other options?
A. Security team network scan results from last year: While useful, these results may be outdated and not specific to the current wireless network configuration.

B. Security tab on Cisco wireless LAN controllers: This tab provides basic security settings but does not offer a comprehensive evaluation of security weaknesses.

C. Security interference results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure: This refers to interference detection, not security weaknesses.

Thus, the Security Index results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure are the most reliable source for identifying security weaknesses in the system.

choices.A: security team network scan results from last year
choices.C: security interference results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure
choices.B: Security tab on Cisco wireless LAN controllers
choices.D: security index results on Cisco Prime Infrastructure

questions.question_text: As part of a PCI audit, an engineer is gathering information on a Cisco Unified Wireless Network environment. The report must include any security weaknesses in the system. Where does the engineer find the related information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Question says user data is to be offloaded to the local Internet link and not sent back to the WLC via CAPWAP. Therefore B. Central switching must be incorrect.

Selected Answer: C
AP control and management traffic must be tunneled to a centralized WLC via CAPWAP.

User traffic must utilize the local Internet line (i.e., it should not be tunneled back to the WLC).

Locally Switched FlexConnect is the appropriate configuration because:

Control and Management Traffic: FlexConnect APs tunnel control and management traffic to the centralized WLC via CAPWAP.

User Traffic: User traffic is locally switched at the branch office, meaning it does not need to be tunneled back to the WLC and can instead use the local Internet connection.

Why Not the Other Options?
A. Wireless Mesh Network: This is used for extending wireless coverage in areas where wired backhaul is not available. It does not address the requirement for local switching of user traffic.

B. Centrally Switched FlexConnect: In this mode, both control/management traffic and user traffic are tunneled back to the WLC. This does not meet the requirement for local Internet usage.

D. WLC in Local Mode: In local mode, all traffic (control, management, and user) is tunneled back to the WLC. This does not meet the requirement for local switching of user traffic.

questions.question_text: An engineer deploys APs to a branch office. All AP control and management-related traffic must be tunneled to a centralized WLC via CAPWAP. All user traffic must utilize the local Internet line. What should be configured?
